sen.j: 橋本家（はしもとけ）
sen.e: The Hashimoto family
The Hashimoto family
The Hashimoto family

sen.j: 藤原北家閑院流、西園寺流の公家。
sen.e: A court noble of Kanin-ryu (the Kanin lineage), Sionji-ryu of the northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
The family were court nobility of Kanin-ryu (the Kanin lineage) and Sionji-ryu of the northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: Added "and". I think this means that the family belonged to both "ryu". If this is the case, "and" is required.
sen.e: The family were court nobility of Kanin-ryu (the Kanin lineage) and Saionji-ryu of the northern House of the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 西園寺公相の子西園寺実俊から始まる。
sen.e: The family started from Sanetoshi SAIONJI who was the son of Kinsuke SAIONJI.
The family orginated with Sanetoshi SAIONJI who was the son of Kinsuke SAIONJI.
sen.cmt: I think "originated with" is better than "started from".
sen.e: The family originated with Sanetoshi SAIONJI who was the son of Kinsuke SAIONJI.

sen.j: 伯爵。
sen.e: The earl.
The earl.
The earl.

sen.j: 本項にて解説。
sen.e: Described in the main paragraph.
Described in the main section.
sen.cmt: It is not clear that the main passage is a single paragraph. Hence, "main section" is better.
sen.e: Described in the main section.

sen.j: 新華族。
sen.e: A new nobility.
New nobility
New nobility

sen.j: 陸軍軍医総監などを務めた橋本綱常が、勲功により、明治28年10月31年男爵に叙せられる。
sen.e: Tsunatsune HASHIMOTO who served as the army surgeon general was baronized on October 31, 1895 due to his deed of valor.
Tsunatsune HASHIMOTO who served as the army surgeon general was made a baron on October 31, 1895 in recognition of his acts of valor.
Tsunatsune HASHIMOTO who served as the army surgeon general was made a baron on October 31, 1895 in recognition of his acts of valor.

sen.j: 明治40年9月23日子爵に陞爵。
sen.e: Advanced in peerage to a viscount on September 23, 1907.
He then became a viscount on September 23, 1907.
He then became a viscount on September 23, 1907.

sen.j: 橋本家（はしもとけ）は、羽林家の家格を有する公家。
sen.e: The Hashimoto family was a court noble with a family status of the Urin family.
The Hashimoto belonged to the court nobility and held a family status of the Urin.
The Hashimoto belonged to the court nobility and held a family status of the Urin.

sen.j: 藤原北家閑院流。
sen.e: Kanin-ryu of the northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
The family was Kanin-ryu of the northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: I think that this sentence needs a subject.
sen.e: The family was Kanin-ryu of the northern House of the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 西園寺家分家。
sen.e: A branch of the Saionji family.
It was branch of the Sainoji family
It was branch of the Saionji family

sen.j: 江戸時代の家禄は500石。
sen.e: The hereditary stipend in the Edo period was 500 koku.
The hereditary stipend in the Edo period was 500 koku.
The hereditary stipend in the Edo period was 500 koku.

sen.j: 明治維新後、伯爵。
sen.e: Became the earl after the Meiji Restoration.
The family was awarded the title of earl after the Meiji restoration.
sen.cmt: trans 1 is missing a subject. Who or what became the earl?
sen.e: The family was awarded the title of earl after the Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: 家業は笛。
sen.e: The family business was a flute.
The family business was the flute.
The family business was the flute.

sen.j: 家紋は尾長巴。
sen.e: The family crest was an onaga-domoe, a Japanese traditional pattern of three long tails.
The family crest was an onaga-domoe, a Japanese traditional pattern of three long tails.
The family crest was an onaga-domoe, a Japanese traditional pattern of three long tails.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代末期、西園寺公相の四男橋本実俊を祖として創設される。
sen.e: The family was created by the ancestor Sanetoshi HASHIMOTO, the fourth son of Kinsuke SAIONJI at the end-Kamakura period.
The family originated with Sanetoshi HASHIMOTO, the fourth son of Kinsuke SAIONJI at the end-Kamakura period.
The family originated with Sanetoshi HASHIMOTO, the fourth son of Kinsuke SAIONJI at the end-Kamakura period.

sen.j: 実俊は冷泉・橋本・入江などを称していたが、孫の橋本実澄の代から橋本の家名が定まった。
sen.e: Sanetoshi identified himself as Reizei, Hashimoto, or Irie; the family name of Hashimoto was defined in the generation of his grand son, Sanezumi HASHIMOTO.
Sanetoshi variously identified himself as Reizei, Hashimoto and Irie, the family only settling on the name Hashimoto in the generation Sanezumi HASHIMOTO, Sanetoshi's grandson
Sanetoshi variously identified himself as Reizei, Hashimoto and Irie, the family only settling on the name Hashimoto in the generation Sanezumi HASHIMOTO, Sanetoshi's grandson.

sen.j: 6代目の橋本公国まで父子相続が続いたが、公国に跡継ぎがなく、同じ西園寺家一門の清水谷家から橋本公夏（1454年－1538年）が養子に入った。
sen.e: The father-son succession continued until the period of Kinkuni HASHIMOTO, the sixth generation; however, Kinnatsu HASHIMOTO (1454-1538) was adopted from the Shimizudani family which was the sept of the same Saionji family as Kinkuni had no successors.

The father-son succession continued until Kinkuni HASHIMOTO, the sixth generation, who Kinkuni did not produce an heir, at which point Kinnatsu HASHIMOTO (1454-1538) was adopted from the Shimizudani family of the same Saionji clan.

The father-son succession continued until Kinkuni HASHIMOTO, the sixth generation, who did not produce an heir, at which point Kinnatsu HASHIMOTO (1454-1538) was adopted from the Shimizudani family of the same Saionji clan.

sen.j: 公夏は播磨国で出家し、彼の後は孫で養子の橋本実勝が継いだが、天正16年（1588年）横死して家系は中絶。
sen.e: Kinnatsu went into religion in the Province of Harima and his adopted grandson Sanekatsu HASHIMOTO succeeded to the family, but he died a violent death in 1588 and the family line was terminated.
Kinnatsu became a monk in the Province of Harima was succeeded by his adopted grandson Sanekatsu HASHIMOTO, but Sanekatsu died a violent death in 1588 and the family line was terminated.
Kinnatsu became a monk in Harima Province and was succeeded by his adopted grandson Sanekatsu HASHIMOTO, but Sanekatsu died a violent death in 1588 and the family line was terminated.
sen.cmt: and補足"the Province of Harima" -> "Harima Province" に変更しました。

sen.j: その後、江戸時代初期に一族の橋本実村（公夏の曾孫）が実勝の養子の形式で家を継いだ。
sen.e: Then, Sanemura HASHIMOTO of the family (a great-grandson of Kinnatsu) succeeded to the family at the beginning of Edo period in the form of the adopted son of Sanekatsu.
Thereafter, Sanemura HASHIMOTO (a great-grandson of Kinnatsu) restarted the familyat the beginning of Edo period by becoming the adopted son of Sanekatsu.
Thereafter, Sanemura HASHIMOTO (a great-grandson of Kinnatsu) restarted the family at the beginning of Edo period by becoming the adopted son of Sanekatsu.

sen.j: 実村の弟実清（梅園実清）は分家して梅園家の祖となった。
sen.e: Sanekiyo (Sanekiyo UMEZONO), the younger brother of Sanemura, created a branch family and became the ancestor of the Umezono family.
Sanekiyo (Sanekiyo UMEZONO), the younger brother of Sanemura, established a branch family called the Umezono family.
Sanekiyo (Sanekiyo UMEZONO), the younger brother of Sanemura, established a branch family called the Umezono family.

sen.j: 江戸時代後期の橋本実久は議奏を務め、安政の内裏造営のときも御用掛を務めた。
sen.e: Sanehisa HASHIMOTO in the late Edo period served as a giso (a position conveying what the congress decides to the emperor), and also worked as a Goyogakari (a person responsible) at the time of rebuilding of Kyoto imperial-palace at Ansei period.

Sanehisa HASHIMOTO in the late Edo period served as Giso (a position repsonsible for conveying what the congress decides to the emperor), and also worked as a Goyogakari at the time of rebuilding of Kyoto imperial-palace in the Ansei period.
sen.cmt: "a person responsible" is not sufficient as an explanation of Goyogakari. A more specific explanation is required.
sen.e: Sanehisa HASHIMOTO in the late Edo period served as Giso (a position respsonsible for conveying what the congress decides to the emperor), and also worked as a Goyogakari at the time of rebuilding of Kyoto imperial-palace in the Ansei period.

sen.j: 江戸時代末期、明治維新期の橋本実麗（さねあきら）は、国事に尽力。
sen.e: Saneakira HASHIMOTO at the end of Edo period to the Meiji Restoration worked hard for the affairs of State.
From end of Edo period to the Meiji Restoration, Saneakira HASHIMOTO played an active role in the affairs of State.
From the end of Edo period to the Meiji Restoration, Saneakira HASHIMOTO played an active role in the affairs of State.

sen.j: 実麗の妹、観行院（つねこ、観行院）は、仁孝天皇に典侍として仕え、14代将軍徳川家茂に降嫁した和宮親子内親王の生母となった。
sen.e: Kangyoin (Tsuneko, Kangyoin), the younger sister of Saneakira, worked as a maid of honor to Emperor Ninko, and became a birth mother of Imperial Princess Chikako KAZUNOMIYA who was married to Iemochi TOKUGAWA, the fourteenth Shogun.

Kangyoin (Tsuneko, Kangyoin), the younger sister of Saneakira, worked as a maid of honor to Emperor Ninko, and gave birth to Imperial Princess Chikako KAZUNOMIYA who was married to Iemochi TOKUGAWA, the fourteenth Shogun.

Kangyoin (Tsuneko, Kangyoin), the younger sister of Saneakira, worked as a maid of honor to the Emperor Ninko, and gave birth to Imperial Princess Chikako KAZUNOMIYA who was married to Iemochi TOKUGAWA, the fourteenth Shogun.

sen.j: 和宮は、仁孝天皇崩御後は、橋本家で養育された。
sen.e: KAZUNOMIYA was fostered in the Hashimoto family after the death of Emperor Ninko.
KAZUNOMIYA was brought up in the Hashimoto family after the death of Emperor Ninko.
KAZUNOMIYA was brought up in the Hashimoto family after the death of the Emperor Ninko.

sen.j: 実麗の子の橋本実梁（さねやな）は、戊辰戦争で東海道鎮撫総督となる。
sen.e: Saneyana HASHIMOTO, the son of Saneakira, became the General of the force calming Tokaido in the Boshin War.
Saneyana HASHIMOTO, the son of Saneakira, became the General of the force controlling Tokaido in the Boshin War.
Saneyana HASHIMOTO, the son of Saneakira, became the General of the force controlling Tokaido in the Boshin War.

sen.j: 明治17年7月7日伯爵の位を授けられた。
sen.e: The earlship was given to him on July 7, 1884.
He was made an earl on July 7, 1884.
He was made an earl on July 7, 1884.

sen.j: 橋本実斐（さねあや）は、貴族院議員、内務省参与官、文部省政務次官を歴任した。
sen.e: Saneaya HASHIMOTO served as the member of House of Lord, the Counselor of the Internal Ministry, and the Vice-Minister of the Education Ministry successively.
Saneaya HASHIMOTO served as a member of the House of Lords, the Counselor of the Internal Ministry, and the Vice-Minister of the Education Ministry.
sen.cmt: I think "the House of Lords" is more natural. Also, I think "successively" can be omitted.
sen.e: Saneaya HASHIMOTO served as a member of the House of Lords, the Counselor of the Internal Ministry, and the Vice-Minister of the Education Ministry.
